section: Except as agreed upon by mutual consent, the Joint Venturers shall not be required to make any capital contribution to the Joint Venture.
explanation: This section states that capital contributions are not required unless mutually agreed upon. However, Section 9 later mentions that 'No Joint Venturer shall withdraw, transfer or have paid to him in any manner any part of his capital contribution or account...'. This implies that there might be capital contributions, even if not initially required, creating an in-text contradiction.

section: However, either Joint Venturer may unilaterally terminate the agreement with written notice of sixty (60) days.
explanation: Section 8 specifies that the Joint Venture will last until February 28, 2004, unless extended by written agreement. However, it also allows either party to unilaterally terminate with 60 days' notice. This creates ambiguity. If one party terminates with 60 days' notice before February 28, 2004, does that override the initial term? This presents an in-text contradiction, making the term of the agreement unclear.

section: Notwithstanding the foregoing, PVSS shall be entitled to receive a guaranteed payment of $10,000 per month, regardless of the Joint Venture's profitability.
explanation: Section 9 states that distributions may only be made if the Joint Venture assets are in excess of all liabilities. However, it then provides that PVSS is entitled to a guaranteed payment of $10,000 per month, regardless of profitability. This is a contradiction because the guaranteed payment could violate the condition that distributions can only be made when assets exceed liabilities. It is a contradiction in text and legal terms.
